Dating: AMENHOTEP II/AMENOPHIS II/AAKHEPERURE (not before); 18TH DYNASTY; TUTHMOSIS IV/MENKHEPERURE (not after)
Name: Sculpture of a man
Description: The sculpture shows a man, possible a high-up Egyptian official, sitting on an undecorated throne and leaning back against a pillar. He is wearing a wig that does not cover his ears; his eyes are almond shaped and the eyebrows are wide. The body has been somewhat roughly hewn: the hands and feet are both overly large. He is wearing a semi-transparent, short-sleeved shirt with gathered neck opening, while the skirt is long and tied at the waist. There is no inscription to tell us the owner's name.
